intro: Diplospora pubescens, commonly known as the hairy diplospora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often as a shrub or small tree. The plant has a long flowering period and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
